citations.narrative:
In the alpaca enclosure, the primary fence is secured to the uprights using metal fasteners. The metal has been trimmed,
leaving a 1/4-1/2 sharp edge in many spots on the fenceline. These sharp points have the potential to injure the alpacas
housed in the enclosure. The outdoor housing facility shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury.
Correct by 10 December 2025 or next scheduled relicense inspection.
This is a (1st/2nd) Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 30 January 2026 or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
In the alpaca enclosure, the primary fence is secured to the uprights using metal fasteners. The metal has been trimmed, 
leaving a 1/4-1/2 sharp edge in many spots on the fenceline. These sharp points have the potential to injure the alpacas 
housed in the enclosure. The outdoor housing facility shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury. 
 
Correct by 10 December 2025 or next scheduled relicense inspection. 
 
This is a (1st/2nd) Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 30 January 2026 or the applicant will forfeit the license 
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
